posts.title: hello World
posts.body: The "Hello, World!" program, a ubiquitous introductory program in computer programming, originated in the late 1970s, specifically with the publication of "The C Programming Language" by Brian Kernighan and Dennis Ritchie. This book used it as a simple example to illustrate the C language's syntax. While similar examples existed earlier in the B language, the C version cemented its place as a standard first program for learning new languages.

posts.title: mercury
posts.body: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system, and the closest to the Sun. It is a rocky planet with a heavily cratered surface, similar to Earth's moon. Mercury has a thin atmosphere and a very large iron core.

posts.title: AI In 2025
posts.body: In 2025, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is poised to become even more integrated into daily life, with advancements in areas like autonomous agents, cybersecurity, and personalized learning. AI will also play a bigger role in shaping how we work and learn, with a shift towards augmented working and hyper-personalized online learning experiences.

fruits.title: Apple
fruits.body: Depending on the variety, apples can be sweet or tart, but they usually have a crispy, juicy texture.

fruits.title: Banana
fruits.body: banana is an elongated, edible fruit—botanically a berry—produced by several kinds of large treelike herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

fruits.title: Strawberries
fruits.body: Strawberries are a juicy red fruit with a high water content. The seeds provide plenty of dietary fiber per serving.

fruits.title: Mango
fruits.body: A mango is an edible stone fruit produced by the tropical tree Mangifera indica. It originated from the region between northwestern Myanmar, Bangladesh, and northeastern India

fruits.title: Orange
fruits.body: The orange, also called sweet orange to distinguish it from the bitter orange, is the fruit of a tree in the family Rutaceae.

fruits.title: Grapes
fruits.body: A grape is a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis. Grapes are a non-climacteric type of fruit, generally occurring in clusters.

fruits.title: Cherry
fruits.body: A cherry is the fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe. Commercial cherries are obtained from cultivars of several species, such as the sweet Prunus avium.

fruits.title: Blueberry
fruits.body: Blueberries are a widely distributed and widespread group of perennial flowering plants with blue or purple berries. They are classified in the section Cyanococcus within the genus Vaccinium.

fruits.title: Coconut
fruits.body: The coconut tree is a member of the palm tree family and the only living species of the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the whole coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit.

fruits.title: Kiwi
fruits.body: Kiwifruit, or Chinese gooseberry, is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia. The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval.

fruits.title: Pineapple
fruits.body: The pineapple is a tropical plant with an edible fruit; it is the most economically significant plant in the family Bromeliaceae. The pineapple is indigenous to South America.

fruits.title: Pomegranate
fruits.body: The pomegranate is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub in the family Lythraceae, subfamily Punicoideae, that grows between 5 and 10 m tall.
